messages.message: Do we ever have customers asking us about encrypting files on disk? Do we just rely on disk encryption tools or do we have something built into the product to decrypt/encrypt?
is this what you’re looking for? https://www.instabase.com/docs/reference/administration/encryption/

We’ve seen this ask come from customers who are on AWS, their immediate instinct seems to be not to trust AWS’s encryption, and that’s why they’ve asked us to implement a layer of client-side encryption on top of that in file-system layer. However, the only customer we’ve actually had to roll this feature out to so far is Capital One, and currently in the progress of setting it up for SC.
Thanks @Serena - looks like all of our documentation is around AWS. How would this change for GCP?
@Heymian A customer is asking us about this - what happens when a file is placed on our fileshare and what kind of encryption is involved
We don’t support client-side encryption on GCP at the moment.  We only support integration with AWS KMS for storing keys.

If this is an ask that needs to be prioritized, can you please file a new product feature request on the PFR board through the product team? I’ve added a jira to my team’s backlog for now, but we likely won’t be looking into it until later. https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-1311
Thanks Heymian, not really a hard requirement at the moment
@Will if it eventually will become a requirement, it’ll be helpful to file a ticket for us to track this - especially if other customers ask for the same thing later
